export_market_history.text_1: Now you can export the entire history of your trades to analyze them. The table will display item names, the amount received from the action in your account's currency and in cents, the date of listing, purchase, and other useful data.
export_market_history.text_2: Once you select the number of items whose history you want to obtain, the file generation process will begin. Please note that the larger the range of items you choose, the longer the file generation will take.
export_market_history.text_3: After the file is generated, you will be able to download it by clicking the corresponding button.
export_market_history.tooltip_1: If you're experiencing issues with the visual display of data in the file, it may be due to your version of Excel. In that case, you should upload the report file to Google Sheets — this will resolve the problem.

tooltips.roi: ROI (Return on Investment) - This is a popular metric for evaluating the profitability of opening a case at the moment. We calculate it as follows: (average value of each item in the case) / (cost of the case + cost of opening) * 100
tooltips.profit: Profit is the sum of the probabilities of all items that can drop from a case, whose value is higher than the cost of opening the case.
tooltips.profitability: Profitability is the minimum and maximum price among all items that can drop from a case.

filterPaintSeedSettingLabel: Enter the pattern, separated by commas:
howManyDoYouWantToChoose: How many do you want to choose?
manifestModalContentPt1:
Due to the migration of the extension to Google Manifest v3 standards, older versions of Steam Inventory Helper will lose some functionality, including: automatic trade acceptance, item re-listing, price information retrieval, etc. To preserve the extension's capabilities, it is necessary to install the new version of the application, which will be updated automatically once it is ready. This will require granting additional permissions to the new version. Let's consider some of them:

declarativeNetRequest, declarativeNetRequestFeedback, and cookies - these permissions are necessary to restore the current functionality. Previously, these permissions were available to all applications by default in the second version of the manifest, but now they are separated into individual items.

management - the chrome.management API is required to determine which applications are used together with SIH. This is necessary for several purposes:

Avoid conflicts with other applications, where collaboration leads to data display failures on the page or within SIH functionality.

Scammer control. We often receive complaints about skin theft, and during investigations, we find that users have installed applications that manipulate trades or automatically purchase items at inflated prices. We will be able to collect lists of such applications and warn users about threats to their Steam accounts.

unlimitedStorage - needed to speed up application performance by using more than 5 MB of memory.

chrome.proxy - for the convenience of using international platforms. This is necessary so that requests to third-party platforms, such as Buff, are available directly to the user without using third-party VPN services.

We strive not only to preserve all functionality but also to add new features, such as comparing item prices with other platforms and accelerating the process of loading prices directly. To achieve this, we need to change the permissions format and request additional permissions from you, including access to all sites. This access is necessary for direct queries to price sources, without using our servers. We will request it only once to avoid repeated requests. You can always deny any access in the extension settings.

SIH continues to remain transparent, so all changes and permissions will be described and added to our updated
manifestModalContentPt3: Details of the migration and all discussion can be found here:
manifestCheckboxLabelPt1: I confirm that I am fully aware of the changes to the
manifestCheckboxLabelPt3: regarding the transition of the SIH extension to Google Manifest v3 standards

steam_error.9: This Steam account already owns the product(s) contained in this offer. To access them, visit your library in the Steam client.
steam_error.13: Sorry, but this product is not available for purchase in this country. Your product key has not been redeemed.
steam_error.14: The product code you've entered is not valid or is not a product code. Please double check to see if you've mistyped your key. I, L, and 1 can look alike, as can V and Y, and 0 and O. If you are redeeming a gift card please click here to redeem it.
steam_error.15: The product code you've entered has already been activated by a different Steam account. This code cannot be used again. Please contact the retailer or online seller where the code was purchased for assistance.
steam_error.24:
The product code you've entered requires ownership of another product before activation.

If you are trying to activate an expansion pack or downloadable content, please first activate the original game, then activate this additional content.
steam_error.36:
The product code you have entered requires that you first play this game on the PlayStation®3 system before it can be registered.

Please:

- Start this game on your PlayStation®3 system

- Link your Steam account to your PlayStation®3 Network account

- Connect to Steam while playing this game on the PlayStation®3 system

- Register this product code through Steam.
steam_error.53: There have been too many recent activation attempts from this account or Internet address. Please wait and try your product code again later.
steam_error.default: An unexpected error has occurred. Your product code has not been redeemed. Please wait 30 minutes and try redeeming the code again. If the problem persists, please contact Steam Support for further assistance.
